frameDefinitions: Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
A Phenomenon, which may be an activity, state or object, is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential Cognizer.
The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.
A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.
An Agent sets down in permanent form information about the occurrence of a Phenomenon.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
frameExamples: Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
Few people would use ATMs if the content of their transaction was <t>secret</t> from their bank and there was no paper trail verifying the transaction. .
The Libyans were <t>generating</t> arms for export.
While visiting in Port Alberni, the day before he was diagnosed, we <t>recorded</t> him to have 14 drinks and go to the bathroom 10 times.
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the activity, state or object that is purposefully hidden from the awareness of a potential cognizer.
A period of <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is hidden from the awareness of potential cognizers.
The Creator creates a created entity.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a created entity.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient entity that creates a permanent record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Agent</fen> becomes aware.
That feature of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is under discussion.
The <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen> that is recorded for the specified <fen>Attribute</fen>.
An <fen>Entity</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> records the <fen>Value</fen> of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> creates the record of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> sets down the facts.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.

This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.

The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.
There was stuff in there that was 'secret' <fex>in the 1980s</fex>, but has since become pretty common knowledge.
They were generating <fex>grenades</fex> for export.
They were assembling <fex>grenades</fex> for export.
Police informed Mr Wong that <fex>they</fex> recorded the attack as a racial incident.
Adams took some very good advice and meticulously recorded <fex>the events that ensued</fex>.

the court recorded <fex>his age</fex> as  17 or 18.

166.6 million dollars</fex>.
At the time the Army recorded <fex>him</fex> as a married resident of the Town of Two Creeks.

<fex>Joe</fex> received communion.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
We baptise children <fex>with holy water</fex>

Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
